document.title: Archdiocese of Galveston Houston Catholic School Religion Curriculum

3CA882A0356B4EA5AABB947E0B184639.description: Sign of the Cross, Grace Before and After Meals, Morning and Evening Prayers, The Guardian Angel Prayer, Our Father, Hail Mary, Glory Be, Act of Contrition, All Mass Responses and Acclamations, Nicene Creed, Fatima Prayer, Hail, Holy Queen, Ten Commandments, Apostle's Creed, Corporal and Spiritual Works of Mercy, Act of Faith, Sorrowful Mysteries of the Rosary, Fruits and Gifts of the Holy Spirit, Eternal Rest Seven Sacraments, Glorious Mystery of the Rosary, Act of Hope, Mass Responses, Precepts of the Church

3FB05B53F4FC4E48AB32D43BE9253F0B.description:
Every disciple of Jesus Christ has a responsibility to serve those
in need through corporal and spiritual works of mercy.

CD8FA17116DD4E1C9494967B8220D50D.description:
The Magisterium has given us guidance in the form of encyclicals and
letters to help us live just lives.

6F19B6B6A8D9493881A5447637F5BC3D.description:
The Church gives us 7 points of Social Teaching by which to model our
lives.

3C0AA2116F094AF7B653DF5E7B8E3F9E.description:
The Saints provide us with examples of how to live justly and with
compassion for others.

2659A92F65F446C689240D1946EDC949.description:
The Old Testament and New Testament both contain scriptural stories
that guide the faithful in living lives of justice and mercy.

91D1040647064261B4B268B7A86F7170.description:
The message of justice and mercy in the Beatitudes is central to the
New Covenant.

0EF1930D19A44E4890D5F50E79BAEC39.description: Jesus Christ taught us how to treat one another with justice and mercy in order to truly live as his disciples.

6BE4244F0DF140C9A98313382F2CD000.description:
The liturgy has undergone changes throughout the history of the
Church in order to better serve the needs of the faithful.

AD1897A78A534DBAA5CE3F2174CE2BBA.description:
The Seven Sacraments are celebrated as part of the Liturgical
work of the Church and help the faithful to lead lives directed
towards Jesus Christ.

AEAA8EE772F249388CCB508F48BED431.description:
The Bishop calls the faithful to "full, active and conscious
participation" in the Liturgy; especially, the Sunday Eucharistic
Celebration, the central liturgical action of the faithfu

D3083D60BAEE4976A7014007D4D0F5C1.description:
The Church marks time with a Liturgical Calendar, in order to
sanctify our days.

0576931C83C947AEBBBF9B43EFF27DCA.description:
The laity, consecrated religious and ordained ministers are called
to join in the work and prayer of the Liturgy of the Hours. The
Liturgy of the Hours is the daily public prayer of the Church,
prayed at regular intervals throughout the day.

C866E8D61FEA446F8D0CA04A8E48556E.description: Liturgy is the public work of the body of Jesus Christ, the Church.

9176835569F844F3A98F2BABC231D5A0.description:
Through the events of the Last Supper and the encounter on the Road
to Emmaus the relationship to the Old Testament covenant becomes
apparent.

FB52C7F3C4424815A888CDBB09C12CC1.description:
The covenant of the New Testament is a fulfillment of the Old
Testament covenant.

D570896AA2CE4F2986F57CF921580D69.description: Jesus fulfills the old covenant by making a new covenant with us.

133E24A4FEE247F2AB9545E22E7E592F.description:
The Passion of our Lord Jesus Christ can be found in all four
Gospels.

B9EF3D5A2FD84AE38D917F4951A98AE1.description:
The four Gospels proclaim the Good News of Jesus Christ's life,
death, and resurrection.

B7D91E2CBC19401E9B47CAF1F0625BF6.description:
The eight beatitudes form part of the teaching given by Jesus during
the Sermon on the Mount which sets forth fundamental attitudes and
virtues for living as a faithful disciple

0ECE3A5C97464F0990ABA11409209869.description:
John the Baptist is the last prophet before the coming of Jesus Christ,
bearing witness to the fulfillment of the Old Testament promise of a
Messiah.

2CAAC12E5E1C428EA17CE397883497F0.description: The New Testament provides an account of the saving actions of Jesus Christ (His life, death, and resurrection).

577784B8EDFD406B991BE8E0F39F41C4.description:
The Prophets relate to the three-fold mission of Jesus Christ (Priest,
Prophet and King) and to the call to baptism.

E4B1702717DD4CD49FD42A5D05125093.description:
There are Christocentric themes in the books of Isaiah, Malachi,
Ezekiel, Daniel and in the other prophets.

1967C0AFB88D4573BBDF44549D58274E.description:
The Prophets are divided into two groups: Major Prophets and Minor
Prophets

0918F785046B43B49AF98643EEEA9D75.description: The Prophets called God's people back to faithfulness to the covenant and foretold the coming of the messiah.

B5B31240C1994B899DBBC8085CF91810.description:
From the Liturgy of the Hours, the Psalms help make connections for
daily living.

104C7E59808046C5B9BC31D97C26C5E1.description:
In the Old Testament and the modern Church, the use of Psalms
in worship liturgies is used extensively.

E3C81B47BF3C45F0928B7C8596CAB2C3.description: The Psalms were sung at the temple, in family settings, on pilgrimages, and in the solitude of personal prayer.

B296C03F62654EEE8BF55FDA48777043.description:
A Foreshadowing of Jesus Christ and the Church can be found in Old
Testament figures, including, but not limited to:
 a. Abraham b. Isaac c. Jacob
 d. Joseph e. David f. Melchizedek

5AA135343CE64F8FAF95557FE441849F.description:
Key Bible Stories that provide a basic foundation to the Old
Testament, include, but are not limited to:
a. Creation & the Fall of Man Genesis 1:1-3:24
b. Noah & the Flood Genesis 7
c. T he Tower of Babel Genesis 11:1-9
d. Joshua Joshua 2-4
e. Deborah Judges 4-5
f. Tobit & the Angel Raphael Tobit 12:1-22
g. Ruth Ruth 1:1-18
h. Esther Esther 8
i. Elijah 2Kings 2:1-13
j. David 2Samuel 5:1-5
k. Judith Judith 15:9-14
l. Solomon 1Kings 3:3-15
m. Babylonian Exile 2Kings 25
n. Examples from Major and Minor Prophets

3CF3E74664224725AF2FCCC21D84D94C.description: In the Old Testament, God spoke to the people through judges and kings, priests and prophets, sages and poets.

54811EE5593D45D0A792939252D5E764.description: The 10 Commandments are an important way for the people of God to show their faithfulness to God's covenant.

0FF92FE5A3B745D4A12007991CF35728.description: The 10 Commandments can be found in the book of Exodus 20:2-17 and Deutoronomy 5:6-21

C688FF7A05D140AF819801790E1A3AC5.description: Each of the 10 Commandments obliges the people of God to follow faithfully and grow in their relationship with God and his people.

D9B433EFEF514D3BAEB605C439BF4D1D.description: The 10 Commandments, or Decalogue, are the foundation of the Old Testament Covenant.

B4F35F2082964BE58C9D6BFD65E3310E.description: The Decalogue is the 10 commandments given by God to Moses.

74868C5F66624071B3332D86E73A8D9D.description: The progression of the Old Testament covenant is comparable to our own relationship with God.

7AF4A6609E0A408985C9D4C3B84D8F6E.description: There are various covenants mentioned in the Old Testament.

07BD864544184F20BB80BF9F53636AA6.description: A covenant is a solemn agreement between human beings or between God and a human being involving mutual commitments or guarantees.

31E1763DC1824FE39A5F4391807A619E.description: A covenant is a special agreement between God and his people.

659C10A14B1F4B2D996AC1AAF38E891B.description: The ten plagues that Pharaoh and the Egyptians experienced where: Water Turned into Blood, the Frogs, the Gnats, the Flies, the Pestilence, the Boils, the Hail, the Locusts, the Darkness, and the Death of the First-born.

3672D8E5AEE740B7A59DE812CBF02B16.description: The "Call of Moses" in Scripture relates to our Baptismal Call.

0720F987D4E54704964BE175FD8B197A.description: Passover is a foreshadowing of the events of the Last Supper of Jesus Christ and his  and his disciples.

26A3F347695C46069FF5899BD9C78907.description: The story of Exodus is found in the book of Exodus.

DBAA8033FD0640A9B6D165342464933B.description: The central event of the old testament is the exodus.

E42020686AAC4E919D19D2B5AA2DF637.description: Stories of the Patriarchs within Sacred Scripture foreshadow events in the New Testament, especially in the life of Jesus Christ.

BEEB6CEC6C73401489D9A7EC928CB2FF.description: Patriarch is a title given to the venerable ancestors or "fathers" of the Semitic peoples, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, who received God's promise of election.

66EAFBD50E0C442E8B53B86FC67B8C77.description: The patriarchs are Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

2D3CF27F9BA343AFACFBC63BEB8DD457.description: The Protestant Bible is different from the Catholic Bible due to the removal of several books from the Canon of Scripture.

733DB3C5DAE14157A2B58881214B254D.description: The Canon of Scripture includes 46 books for the Old Testament and 27 for the New Testament.

1262D312C6B14012ADD122E1F3D821CC.description: Passages in Sacred Scripture can be cited by abbreviating the book name and including the chapter and verse numbers.

DDDCDE8037A949338CC249C697821F96.description: The system used to reference scripture includes book name, chapter number and verse number (Ex. Genesis 1:1)

D2A57357E0814A72A6A5857F81BA0404.description: The book of Genesis has two symbolic stories of creation that reveal God as the source of all life.

9C0D275D7BC3472FB8EB4625BF3CFABE.description: The human authors of sacred scripture had various purposes for the effective use of different literary forms.

47B898BF6D894730AE923BCD21D5CC6C.description: Different types of literary forms are used in various scripture passages, including, but not limited to: a. Genesis, b. Job, c. Jonah, d. Psalms, e. Daniel, f. 1&2Maccabees, g. Wisdom, h. Epistles of St Paul

2DFC126247754744B1C91BB00D4E29BD.description: The human authors of the books of the bible used many different literary forms to convey God's message. These include historical accounts, parables, poetry, letters, allegories and proverbs.

6B24642AE8ED44CFBC647C5E0E28A589.description: The divinely revealed realities, which are contained and presented in the text of Sacred Scripture, have been written down under the inspiration of the Holy Spirit; therefore, God is the author of Sacred Scripture.

5875F7E58BBB4A7CB691BF6EBAE5C09C.description: Scripture and Tradition make up a single Sacred Deposit.

D10DA97093EB42C09260C9F336EAD340.description: Jesus Christ is the Mediator and is the fullness of all revelation.

38B03835AC4E463F8CA4353559FED89A.description: Jesus Christ is the summit of revelation. Scripture and divine tradition make up a single deposit. God is the author of sacred scripture.

BDF31563095E4EC8A8C5E64B71EE2536.description: Humans are created in the image and likeness of God with special dignity and the responsibility of being stewards of creation.

703FC3F13C864A95920806B25D0448E7.description: The Bible is the inspired Word of God.

7F38102153D54613AC36A76BC69C8C6C.description: The Paschal Mystery is the passion, death, resurrection and ascension of Jesus Christ. The Paschal Mystery is most especially remembered and celebrated in the Eucharist.

20669B92E0524D4F875C3A947D836CF7.description: Divine Inspiration is the guidance of God the Holy Spirit given to the writers of the Bible.

599A52A83783418EADB6B6E6423CF65E.description: The work of the Blessed Trinity in creation is the source of all life and goodness.

C843F181B5E047B7B4AEFBD48843EF12.description: Divine Revelation is relational and calls us to actively receive what God has first given

899C66FDDE99434886076FE786A9AF0B.description: Revelation is God telling us about himself, ourselves and the world around us, and inviting us into relationship with him
